alert.note: Alert for Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 03 at 1:34PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following area, Northern Inner Channels. * WHEN...Until 530 PM AKDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 126 PM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in Areas along low lying portions of the Chilkoot Trail. Minor flooding is ongoing near the Taiya River. Between 0.75 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Areas along low lying portions of the Chilkoot Trail is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. It appears that the Taiya River has crested late this Saturday morning. Water levels though still above minor flood stage are anticipated to fall through the afternoon and evening. - For Taiya River near Skagway: At 1:00pm the stage was 16.8 feet. Flood Stage is 16.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 16.9 feet was observed around 10:00am Saturday. Impacts: At 16.1 feet: Portions of the Chilkoot Trail begins to inundate with water. At 16.8 feet: Portions of the first few miles of the Chilkoot Trail will begin to inundate with water to ankle depth.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
